attributes.name: Charisma
attributes.description: Charisma dictates how others perceive you, and how much they like you. It controls your ability to interact and communicate with individuals, as well as your ability to manipulate them.

attributes.name: Constitution
attributes.description: Constitution determines your total health, as well as how resistant you are to suffocation, intoxication, and poisoning.

attributes.name: Dexterity
attributes.description: Dexterity governs your ability to move quickly and silently, and contributes to your defense in light armor.
attributes.governs: Acrobatics, Escape, Sleight of Hand, Ranged, Ride, and Stealth

attributes.name: Intelligence
attributes.description: Intelligence determines how quickly a character learns new concepts and governs all knowledge-based skills. The Ability Points you regain each round is equal to your Intelligence score.

attributes.name: Luck
attributes.description: Luck controls the number of Fortune Points characters get. It also controls less specific bonuses, such as getting better loot, or fewer random encounters. These small turns of fate are perks a GM might grant to characters with high Luck. A low Luck might result in penalties as well. Luck divided by 10 is the number of Fortune Points per day a character starts with.
attributes.governs: Luck doesn't govern any skills directly, but can influence all or any of them.

attributes.name: Speed
attributes.description: Speed controls total movement (in squares), how quickly you can react in a combat setting, and the number of actions you get in a round.
other: 3 + (Speed Modifier) = number of squares you can move with one move action

attributes.name: Strength
attributes.description: Strength controls accuracy and damage in combat. Your Strength score also determines how much equipment you can carry with you.
attributes.governs: Athletics, Melee Weapon, and Unarmed Combat
other: Strength * 3 = Max load you can carry at full movement
Strength * 6 = Max load you can carry and still move
Anything between these two numbers halves your movement

attributes.name: Wisdom
attributes.description: Wisdom controls Ability usage, as well as how easily your character can figure out logic puzzles.
attributes.governs: Control, Destruction, Enhancement, Medicine, Perception, Sense Motive, Survival, and Utility
other: 5 x Wisdom score = total Ability Points
